displayName.text: HUDSON & CHARLES Local Sustainable Grass Fed Meats

formattedAddress: 524 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: HUDSON & CHARLES Local Sustainable Grass Fed Meats
HUDSON & CHARLES Local Sustainable Grass Fed Meats

adrFormatAddress: 524 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: Nose-to-tail butcher offering local, sustainable meats & poultry plus prepared foods & craft beer.

originalText.text: Nice neighborhood butcher and sandwich shop.  They butcher their own meats and can prep certain dishes for pre-ordering, such as turkeys etc.   It also sells vegetables and fruits in season.  Overall, a nice place to shop for the folks in the neighborhood

text.text: Nice neighborhood butcher and sandwich shop.  They butcher their own meats and can prep certain dishes for pre-ordering, such as turkeys etc.   It also sells vegetables and fruits in season.  Overall, a nice place to shop for the folks in the neighborhood

originalText.text: I have been buying weekly in this place! Unfortunately when you call them over the phone they are not very helpful! They have been time when a made a phone called to make sure the have enough chicken because I have to drive all the way to the village so I want to make sure they have what I need before I even hit down there! Many times they are very rude over the phone, not to mention they have told me many times they do have what I asked for but when I get there they say the don’t have enough! Today 10/ 08/2023 I have called to asked if they have 12 chicken breast, of course the person couldn’t even answer the question and he replied I have some chicken but I don’t think I have 12! So I asked do you have 8 chicken breast and he answered I do have it but I can’t guarantee I will have it when I get there! So I replied I go the weekly to buy , I am a regular customer and you are telling me you can’t put those chicken away for me even when I am willing to pay over the phone! He replied absolutely not! I would never buy in the place again! I will be spending my money in a place where they appreciate supporting customers! I absolutely don’t recommend this place at all!

originalText.text:
I’m editing my review to be three stars so hopefully more people will see it than when I chose one star.
The Friday manager treats his employees like garbage. He needs to be seriously disciplined or fired. Since I’ve left this review I’ve seen him mock, scream at, and verbally abuse the workers. I don’t know why the owners still employ him.

text.text:
I’m editing my review to be three stars so hopefully more people will see it than when I chose one star.
The Friday manager treats his employees like garbage. He needs to be seriously disciplined or fired. Since I’ve left this review I’ve seen him mock, scream at, and verbally abuse the workers. I don’t know why the owners still employ him.

originalText.text: the next time you have a bout of the "meat sweats"--ask yourself: were the animals humanely and locally-raised? and grass-fed and/or pasture-raised? the answer is always "yes and yes" at Hudson & Charles bc they are not just selling things as an intermediary...BUT they are actively involved in knowing what they are selling as well as the sourcing of what they selling...and that makes all the difference which you can taste in the high quality cuts of beef. the small butcher shop sits on Hudson Street. the interior is neatly packed with various items from the meats in the main counter to various produce, dairy, and bottled items. the focus is clearly on meats and meaty items. stopped in here placed a order for fresh cow liver, the order was neatly packaged for pickup when i specified, and the service was friendly. the folks here know meats and it shows.  the quality of the liver was AWESOME--cleaned and cut & NOT FROZEN, but fresh. the difference in taste and flavor when i made a pate with it was way above anything i could buy in a normie supermarket. obviously, a much higher quality of meat comes at a higher price and to me...it's worth it especially if you are cooking things like offals. imo, we have become way too disconnected from how basic things we eat come to be and end up on our plates...bc we have become way too over-reliant on factory-farming, gigantic food conglomerates, the mindset of convenience at any cost, the trappings of current modern day life etc. and while the aforementioned gets the "job" done but at what cost to ourselves and everyone else? while butchery is a skilled trade that has existed for the past 1700+ years…it  seems to be fading away, but it's reassuring that Hudson & Charles is still fighting the good fight in NYC so some of us can enjoy a better class of protein.

originalText.text: Beautiful, local, bone-out Lamb roast.  Used these two seasonings I bought at the shop with an additional but of kosher salt.  Into the 275F oven until 125.  Yum!  Thank you H&C for the expertly boneless and tied roast!

text.text: Beautiful, local, bone-out Lamb roast.  Used these two seasonings I bought at the shop with an additional but of kosher salt.  Into the 275F oven until 125.  Yum!  Thank you H&C for the expertly boneless and tied roast!
